_header: And therefore ye lordings that lovedays will hold
_description: An admonition to officers of justice at lovedays — 196 lines in quatrains and couplets, with a few passages in Latin

CULDd11.First Lines:
And þer for ȝe lordingis þat louedays wile holdeLoke
                    ȝe here boþe partyes & who haþ right or
                    wrong…
CULDd11.Last Lines:
…and alle oþere þat don a mysGod graunt hem grace of
                    amendeme[nt]
CULDd11.Attributed Title:
O Iudex vi ferinda hanc seruabis artem. Acutiuali meridional audi
                        alteram partem (f. 300v)
CULDd11.Editions:
Bowers,  Robert Hood. 
             “A Middle English Poem on Love-days.” 
             Modern Language Review
         47 (1952): 374-5: 374 (lines 1-24 only).
